TITLE: 5 tensions that could derail the climate conference
SUMMARY: Set against a backdrop of severe weather disasters, this year’s gathering of world leaders collides with soaring energy costs, food insecurity and a looming recession.

TITLE: ‘Unconditional friend’: Meet the man shadowing Manchin
SUMMARY: Larry Puccio has known the senator for decades. Now he's a lobbyist with clients who have a stake in Manchin's actions on energy policy.

TITLE: COP27 showcases U.S.-China climate action rivalry
SUMMARY: Biden and Xi will offer competing initiatives for developing world support.

TITLE: New U.S. message on climate change: Make China pay
SUMMARY: The U.S. is softening its resistance to paying developing countries for loss and damages suffered from climate change, and it's pointing the finger at China's massive emissions as well.

TITLE: An inconvenient truth: Climate change won't be solved in this desert
SUMMARY: Leaders will gather in Egypt to discuss action to counter global warming. But events elsewhere in the world are pushing in the opposite direction.

TITLE: The oil and gas paradox threatening Biden’s party at the polls
SUMMARY: The president promised to move the U.S. away from fossil fuels. But U.S. oil production is up anyway, and so are federal drilling approvals.

TITLE: Republicans plan an energy agenda designed to keep Democrats on their heels
SUMMARY: House Republicans are also planning to scrutinize how the Biden administration deploys the $370 billion in clean energy measures that Congress approved in Democrats' Inflation Reduction Act.

TITLE: Biden bashes oil sector for ‘war profiteering,’ warns of windfall tax on profits
SUMMARY: Democrats introduced legislation this spring that would tax large oil companies for windfall profits and give the proceeds to consumers as a rebate.

TITLE: EPA opens civil right probe of Mississippi after Jackson water crisis
SUMMARY: The agency will also investigate whether the two state departments have procedural safeguards in place to prevent discrimination, according to the letter.

TITLE: Democrats passed a huge climate bill. Now they’re talking oil.
SUMMARY: The tack is a contrast from 2020, when Democrats including Biden jockeyed with each other to propose sweeping plans for curtailing the long-term threat of global warming.

TITLE: Biden administration to tap oil reserve again ahead of midterms
SUMMARY: Oil prices shot higher last week after the oil producing cartel OPEC and its allied countries announced they would cut their collective production by 2 million barrels a day.

TITLE: Congressional committees probe Mississippi's water spending
SUMMARY: The capital's decrepit water system subjected residents to more than 300 boil water orders in the past two years and left residents without drinking water for days late this summer.

TITLE: Hurricanes Fiona and Ian gave solar power its time to shine
SUMMARY: The green electricity source faces obstacles in Puerto Rico and Florida, where sun power largely held up during Hurricanes Fiona and Ian.

TITLE: Malpass survives climate gaffe, but the World Bank’s fossil fuel policy may not
SUMMARY: Many of the major World Bank contributors have called for varying degrees of change.

TITLE: California's opening bid won't solve the Colorado River crisis alone
SUMMARY: Outside observers say the fact of a formal offer at all from the largest player on the river is an important move at a time when negotiations have been stalled.

TITLE: Hurricane Ian traumatized Floridians. It also erased their nest eggs.
SUMMARY: As climate change makes natural disasters more frequent and severe Ian offered new evidence that Americans' retirement funds and assets are in jeopardy in vulnerable areas.

TITLE: Biden's 'unthinkable' options for punishing OPEC
SUMMARY: Democrats and the White House are vowing a response to OPEC's production cut, but none of the options look particularly appealing.

TITLE: OPEC oil output cut fuels Dems’ gas price fears
SUMMARY: After nearly 100 days of declining prices at the pump this summer, a handful of states are seeing an increase that is lifting the national average higher.

TITLE: Biden shows Puerto Rico he cares. It may not be enough.
SUMMARY: The territory's residents want reliable electricity, a functioning healthcare system and long-promised recovery aid from their 2017 hurricane disaster.

TITLE: Disasters divert Biden's fall agenda
SUMMARY: Hurricanes are suddenly dominating Biden’s agenda in the final sprint toward the November midterms.

SUMMARY: The funds will come from the recently enacted infrastructure law.

TITLE: Live near water? Get flood insurance, FEMA admin says after Ian.
SUMMARY: “Just because you’re not required to buy flood insurance doesn’t mean you don’t have the option to buy it.”

TITLE: Officials assess massive hurricane damage as Florida begins long recovery
SUMMARY: Leaders ponder what Florida will look like after Ian's lethal impact.

TITLE: Dozens dead from Ian, one of strongest, costliest U.S. storms
SUMMARY: Ian was expected to move across central North Carolina on Saturday morning and reach south-central Virginia by the afternoon.

TITLE: Ian will 'financially ruin' homeowners and insurers
SUMMARY: The storm inundated the homes of thousands of Floridians who don't have flood insurance, exposing weaknesses in the nation's effort to address the rising costs of extreme weather.

TITLE: 4 things holding back restoration of Florida’s electric grid
SUMMARY: More than 1.6 million customers in the state remained without power Friday, with no estimate of how many weeks it will take to restore them all.
